title: Religious diversity in Middle East/North Africa in 2010 , by religion
summary: This is a bar chart representing Religion in the x axis and Percentage of population in the y axis.
The maximum Percentage of population 93.0 is found at Religion Muslims and the minimum is found at Unaffiliated where Religion is 1.0.
The difference of Percentage of population between the highest and lowest Religion is 92.0.
min_summary: This is a bar chart representing Religion in the x axis and Percentage of population in the y axis.
The Percentage of population is highest at Religion Muslims and lowest at Religion Unaffiliated.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart representing Religion in the x axis and Percentage of population in the y axis.
The maximum Percentage of population 93.0 is found at Religion Muslims and the minimum is found at Unaffiliated where Religion is 1.0.
The difference of Percentage of population between the highest and lowest Religion is 92.0.
max_summary: This is a bar chart representing Religion in the x axis and Percentage of population in the y axis.
Religion Muslims has the highest Percentage of population and Unaffiliated has the lowest Percentage of population.
Religion Christians has the second highest value for Percentage of population.
The difference of Percentage of population between the highest and lowest Religion is 92.0.
The Religion Muslims has the highest Percentage of population, followed by Christians, and Jews. Down to the Religion Unaffiliated which is the lowest.
Religion Unaffiliated, and Hindus have a similar Percentage of population that is 1.0.
The average Percentage of population in all 5 Religions is 20.2.
